JOINT SURG HARSheet 1-10
2
I hereby declare that the immovable property valued at Rs. 4,93,000-00 in letters four lakh ninety three thousand rupees is hereby transferred to you free of charge and without any consideration and is hereby transferred to you with all rights and title. Therefore, from now on, you shall keep the Scheduled Property in your possession and shall pay the Panchayat taxes, etc. payable on the property as per the Scheduled Property, and shall enjoy it as you wish, with all the full rights of donation, exchange, sale, and possession, throughout our sons and grandsons' descendants. If you enjoy it in this way, you and your heirs and I and our heirs will not be able to make any kind of dispute, claim or dispute before you. If any dispute, claim or dispute arises in the future regarding the Scheduled Property, I will be able to settle all such matters at my own expense and on my own responsibility and will be able to circulate it freely under you. I have all the rights in the Scheduled Property. I have not committed any encroachment on anyone before.
The said Property is not an assignment as defined in the Act No. 9/77 of the Government of Sri A.P. Government and does not belong to the Government. This Property is not a security to the Government or any of its other institutions.
Schedule:
The Property in the village of Ulichi Gram Panchayat, situated in Ongole Registration District, Ammanabrolu Sub-District, Prakasam District, Ongole Rural Mandal, has come to me from my ancestral property and I have been enjoying full and complete possession of the Property.
Ulichi Village D.No. 395, L.P.No. 1028, Assessment No. 517, Door No. 3-117, the house and premises of which I have given you the land.
East:
Paleti Seshayya's property boundary. A. 17 m. 10 m.
Panchayat road boundary. A. 48 m.
South:
West:
Panchayat road boundary. A. 17 m. 10 m.
:
Bommala Thirupatamma's property boundary. A. 48 m.
Between these four boundaries, the land measuring 91-2 m. and measuring 76-25 m.
and out of which 5 years ago, The R.C.C. Terrace House, all its unique roof, woodwork, doors, door frames, electricity and all rights therein, bound in 243-09 (21.9x11.10) are hereby delivered and taken into your possession.
A.PrabhakarSheet Endorsement

This declaration is hereby notified That is, in the context of preparing this document, we have thoroughly examined all the necessary elements such as pass books, copies of documents, tax receipts for the property and land in this document, tax receipts for the linked documents, details of the parties in the linked document, addresses of the parties, photos of the parties, details of the property, etc. and have included them in the document and have prepared the document. The schedule property was physically examined and measured as part of the document and the document was drawn up. sections.content:
The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 1544 of 2026, dated 31/Jan/2026, executed by Devarapalli Prabhakar, in favour of his Son, Devarapalli Jivanbabu, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 91-2 Sq. Yds., bearing house number 3-117, and Assessment Number 517, comprised in survey number 395, and LP Number 1028, situated in Ulichi Village and Grama Panchayath, Ongole Rural Mandal, within the District of Prakasam, registered at sub-registrar office Guntur (R.O.), is bounded as follows:

North by: 48 Ft Property Boundary of Bommala Thirupatamma
South by: 48 Ft Panchayat Road Boundary
East by: 17.10 Ft. Property Boundary of Paleti Seshayya
West by: 17.10 Ft. Panchayat Road Boundary

(A) As per Registered Documents: 1. The property in survey number 395, bearing house no. 3-117, situated in Ulichi measuring about 91-2 Sq. Yds., was originally owned by Devarapalli Prabhakar, who acquired the property through inheritance from his Ancestors. [Ref: Deed] 2. The aforementioned Devarapalli Prabhakar, executed a Gift Settlement Deed on 31/Jan/2026, registered as document No. 1544 of 2026, before the SRO Guntur (R.O), in favour of his Son, Devarapalli Jivan Babu, towards the property measuring 91-2 Sq. Yds., bearing house no. 3-117 and Assessment Number 517, comprised in survey no. 395 and LP Number 1028, situated at Ulichi. (B) Additional Documents Supporting the Title : The Property Tax Receipt No. 320, dated 01/Mar/2023 , imprinted by the Ulichi Grama Panchayath Secretary discloses that Devarapalli Prabhakar, has paid property tax for the period 2022 to 2023, towards house number 3-117 and Assessment Number 517. Note : It is advisable to verify that the tax is paid up-to-date towards the schedule property.
The HTR attached discloses that Devarapalli Prabhakar, is the taxpayer, hence, it is presumed that the mutation proceedings were not concluded in the name of the current owner Devarapalli Jivanbabu.

contentList: Document Name * Document Description * Document Date * Document Type

sections.content:
We have reviewed the documents provided to us as per the F.I. policy and have concluded that the Devarapalli Jivanbabu, possesses a clear, valid, and marketable title to the property admeasuring an extent of 91-2  Sq. Yds., bearing house number 3-117 and Assessment Number 517, comprised in survey number 395 and LP Number 1028, situated in Ulichi Village and Grama Panchayath, Ongole Rural Mandal, within the District of Prakasam registered at sub-registrar office Guntur (R.O).

Further, the current owner, Devarapalli Jivanbabu, is to be added as a party to the loan structure along with the applicant Devarapalli Sulochana.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number, and Split Survey/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
